means: 变迁兴衰( vicissitude的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: He experienced several great social vicissitudes in his life.
sentence.Network_cn: 他一生中经历了几次大的社会变迁.

sentence.Network_en: A man used to vicissitudes is not easily dejected.
The vicissitudes of life may suddenly make a rich man very poor.
sentence.Network_cn: 在人世的沧桑中,一个有钱人突然也会变成穷光蛋.

entry.def: You use vicissitudes to refer to changes, especially unpleasant ones, that happen to someone or something at different times in their life or development.

example.ex: Whatever the vicissitudes of her past life, Jill now seems to have come through.
example.tran: 不管过去经历了什么坎坷，吉尔现在似乎都已经挺过来了。

auth_sentence.content: Policymakers too often pretend that they've mastered the vicissitudes of economic life.
auth_sentence.res_content: Policymakers too often pretend that they've mastered the vicissitudes of economic life.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Policymakers too often pretend that they've mastered the vicissitudes of economic life.

auth_sentence.content: Remarkable climatic vicissitudes during past ages.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Remarkable climatic vicissitudes during past ages.

auth_sentence.content: Respect for the rule of law must mean something, irrespective of the vicissitudes of political cycles.
auth_sentence.res_content: Respect for the rule of law must mean something, irrespective of the vicissitudes of political cycles.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Respect for the rule of law must mean something, irrespective of the vicissitudes of political cycles.

He experienced several great social vicissitudes in his life.
sentences.cn: 他一生中经历了几次大的社会变迁。
